alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 2:05PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Slow-moving thunderstorms are producing heavy rainfall over far western portions of the Cerro Pelado wildfire burn scar. Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following county, Sandoval, and in particular the western portion of the Cerro Pelado wildfire burn scar. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen, and this area is vulnerable to flooding and excessive runoff due to the earlier Cerro Pelado wildfire. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include mainly rural areas of East Central Sandoval County, including the western portion of the Cerro Pelado wildfire burn scar. Excessive runoff is expected into Vallecita Creek and other nearby creeks and streams.
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pelado wildfire burn area. Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
